text: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
label: title

text: Ingredients
label: header

text: 5 tablespoons butter (70g)
label: ingredient

text: 1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped
label: ingredient

text: 2 medium carrots, finely chopped, about 1 cup chopped
label: ingredient

text: 1 large rib celery, finely chopped
label: ingredient

text: 2 garlic cloves, minced
label: ingredient

text: ¼ cup plus 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour (40g)
label: ingredient

text: 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth or homemade broth (470ml)
label: ingredient

text: 1 cup whole milk (235ml)
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon chopped sage or 1 teaspoon dried sage
label: ingredient

text: 1 cup frozen peas, no need to thaw (135g)
label: ingredient

text: 4 cups shredded or diced cooked or rotisserie chicken, 1 pound shredded (450g)
label: ingredient

text: 1 sheet store-bought puff pastry, thawed, see tips
label: ingredient

text: 1 egg, beaten
label: ingredient

text: ½ teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
label: ingredient

text: Fine sea salt, to taste
label: ingredient

text: Instructions
label: header

text: Prep: Preheat the oven to 400°F (204°C). Set aside a large baking sheet.
label: step

text: Cook veggies: In a 10-inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook, stirring in the skillet, until they soften and take on a little color, about 6 minutes.
label: step

text: Make the gravy: Sprinkle the flour evenly over the vegetables, then stir to form a roux. Cook for 1 minute, then slowly pour in the chicken broth, stirring to prevent lumps. Then stir in the milk and bring to a simmer. Simmer until they thicken into a gravy.
label: step

text: Finish the filling: Add the sage, peas, and shredded chicken. Season with the pepper and a good pinch of salt. Taste, then adjust with more salt and pepper as needed (we use 1 to 1 ½ teaspoons of salt, but it depends on the broth/stock). Cook until the filling is simmering, then remove from the heat and set aside to cool for 10 minutes while you prepare the pastry.
label: step

text: Roll out the pastry: Lightly flour a workbench, then unfold the puff pastry. Roll out to a rectangle 11 inches long on both sides (store-bought sheets are usually rectangles, so one side will probably be longer).
label: step

text: Add the pastry: Carefully lay the puff pastry over the skillet. Trim to an inch or so of the edge, then fold over the pastry to build up the sides. To achieve a thicker edge, cut the trimmed excess dough into strips and press them around the edges.Cut four 2-inch slits in the center of the pie to allow steam to escape, and then brush the top with the beaten egg.
label: step

text: Bake: Place the baking sheet into the oven, and then place the skillet on top of it, so it catches any overflow. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, turning the skillet once halfway through baking. Look for a nicely golden brown, puffed crust on top. If the pastry starts to get too dark, too early, tent with foil.
label: step

text: Serve: Remove from the oven, then allow to rest for 15 minutes before serving.
label: step
